options.text: "We already have an official religion," says @@RANDOM_NAME@@, the white cloaked spokesperson for @@NAME@@'s Concerned Citizens. "Why not enforce it? After all, the only way to Heaven is through Us and Our God. If they will not believe in Our Loving and Forgiving God, well, clearly they must be PUT TO DEATH." [1: [color=blue]Must not have capital punishment[/color] | 2: [color=red]Must have capital punishment[/color]]
options.result: citizens who fail to follow the official national religion are executed

options.text: "Put to death? Is this really the type of person you want to listen to?" says @@RANDOM_NAME@@. "Every day I thank God that I'm an agnostic and don't need to believe this nonsense. Religion shouldn't have anything to do with our government."

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: irreverence towards religion
policiesAndNotabilities.name: irreverence towards religion

options.text: "They're right, religion shouldn't have a role in our government, but they don't go far enough," says @@RANDOM_NAME@@ at a local AA (Atheists Anonymous) meeting. "Few things have caused more death and suffering in this world than religion. Just look at the Crusades and the Jihads throughout history! This should be treated like the mental disorder that it is. Remember, religion teaches intolerance, and we cannot accept that!"
options.result: religious people are committed to mental institutions for treatment

options.text: "Oh Lord, please don't let our noble leader listen to these extremists!" prays your religious advisor, @@RANDOM_NAME@@. "Religion is an important guiding force in peoples' lives, but we have no right to force it on people. Atheists, since they don't have a religion, are less ethical and their actions cost society more, so it's only fair that they should be taxed more heavily to make up the difference."
